nodes.text: A journal was owned by Grand Admiral Thrawn. He eventually left it in the keeping of Commander Eli Vanto as a token of their friendship. The journal contained Thrawn's thoughts on a number of topics, such as the nature of evil, as well as his opinions on strategy. Vanto suspected that the last entry, regarding friendship, may have encompassed the reason why Thrawn left him the journal.
Excerpts from this journal serve as chapter headings for each chapter of the novel Thrawn.
